      • create_kernel_array

        public static double[][][] create_kernel_array(int diameter,
                                               double stdv)
        This method generates a 3D kernel array for gaussian filtering from given parameters.
        Parameters:
        diameter - - side dimension of 'kernel cube' being created
        stdv - - standard deviation used in filtering
        Returns:
        3D double kernel array for gaussian filtering with specified diameter and standard deviation

      • kernel_apply_3d

        public static short[][][] kernel_apply_3d(short[][][] input_array,
                                          double[][][] kernel_array)
        Perform filter on a 3D short array from pre-existing short array
        Parameters:
        input_array - - 3D short array corresponding to image stack pixels
        kernel_array - - kernel array to apply filter
        Returns:
        3D short array filtered in accordance with the kernel array

      • threshold_image

        public static short[][][] threshold_image(short[][][] input_array,
                                          int limit)
        Set array elements below a given threshold to zero (or a black color).
        Parameters:
        input_array - - 3D short array corresponding to image stack pixels
        limit - - array threshold
        Returns:
        thresholded 3D short array

      • flood_fill

        public static short[][][] flood_fill(short[][][] input_array)
        Distinguish directly connected 'pixels' from one another by flood-filling each blob with different color value. TODO: integrate count HashMap into program for center of blobs
        Parameters:
        input_array - - 3D short array corresponding to image stack pixels
        Returns:
        flood filled array
